User Story: As a collection manager or cataloger I want to be able to see who last edited a record and when.
Violations:
The [Role] is more than 1: collection manager, cataloger; The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) see who last edited a record
(2) see when the record was last edited

User Story: As an end user I want to be able to search across all collections at once.
As a cataloger and a collections manager I want Trident to support Duke Core so that metadata is consistent between collections.
Violations: The [Role] is more than 1: cataloger, collections manager

User Story: As a collections manager I want required DC fields to be enforced so that all records have values for all required DC fields.
As a collections manager I want to be able to repeat repeatable DC Fields so that I can enter all of the relevant metadata.
As a collection manager I want to be able to create controlled vocabularies so that they can be used as authority lists during metadata creation.
As a cataloger I want authority lists to be easily accessible and contextually relevant so it is easy to use the authority.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) authority lists to be easily accessible
(2) authority lists to be contextually relevant

User Story: As a collection manager I want to use external authority lists so I they can be used during metadata creation.
As a cataloger I want to be able to see/hear/watch/read the digital object I am cataloging so I don't have to move between multiple applications while I'm creating metadata.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) see the digital object I am cataloging
(2) hear the digital object I am cataloging
(3) watch the digital object I am cataloging
(4) read the digital object I am cataloging

User Story: As a cataloger I want to be able to see/hear/watch/read all components associated on the with an item on the create/update screen so I don't have to leave the form.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) see all components associated with an item on the create or update screen
(2) hear all components associated with an item on the create or update screen
(3) watch all components associated with an item on the create or update screen
(4) read all components associated with an item on the create or update screen

User Story: As a cataloger or collection manager I want to see all of the metadata for a record while I'm editing it so that I have the full context for the item I'm cataloging.
Violations:
The [Role] is more than 1: cataloger, collection manager; The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) see all of the metadata for a record
(2) edit the record

User Story: As a cataloger or collection manager I want to be able to edit an arbitrary number of Items at once so that I can make changes to all Items in a collection efficiently.
Violations: The [Role] is more than 1: cataloger, collection manager

User Story: As a collection manager I want each record to have a status so I can track the progress of the records in the collection.
As a collection manager I want statuses to include a status that flags a record as having a problem so we can track issues as the arise.
As a cataloger I want Trident to support the UTF- character set so that I can use any character necessary when creating metadata.
As a collection manager I want to map fields in inherited metadata to Duke Core fields and import a spreadsheet and create records.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) map fields in inherited metadata to Duke Core fields
(2) import a spreadsheet
(3) create records

User Story: As a collection manager I want to import metadata and create records from a DCP digitazation guide.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) import metadata
(2) create records from a DCP digitization guide

User Story: As a Archivist I want bi-directional linking between items in the digital collections and EAD finding aids.
As a End User I want to be able to see the physical context of an Item in a digital collection (i.e. See inside this folder; EAD)
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) see the physical context of an Item in a digital collection
(2) See inside this folder
(3) EAD

User Story: As a Collection Manager I want my collection to be discoverable in the Catalog.
As a Digital Production User (DPU) I want to be able to create Components.
As a DPU I want to create Technical Metadata with for Component.
As a cataloger or collection manager I want to be able to use a grid/spreadsheet style interface so I can edit Items quickly.
Violations:
The [Role] is more than 1: cataloger, collection manager; The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) use a grid style interface
(2) use a spreadsheet style interface

User Story: As a DPU I want to create Preservation Metadata for a Component.
As a DPU I want to upload master surrogates to a Component.
As a DPU I want to add one or more Components to an Item.
As a DPU I want to create structural metadata for an Item so I can define the sequence of components.
As a Digital Production Developer (DPD) I want to group components that require digitization so that I can create "digitizable units".
As a DPU I want to check-out/check-in groups of Components.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) check-out groups of Components
(2) check-in groups of Components

User Story: As a DPD I want to verify the correctness and completeness of components so that I can ensure quality standards are met.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) verify the correctness of components
(2) verify the completeness of components

User Story: As a DPD I want to capture digitization statistics so that I can monitor Operator efficiency and make projections for future projects.
As a DPU I want Trident to create derivatives for me when I upload a Master.
As a User I want to monitor the progress of a digital collection project.
As a cataloger I want to be able to save a record without all of the required metadata so that I can start a record with the metadata I have and come back to finish it later.
As a user I want to see how many Items have been digitized.
As a user I want to see how many digitized Items have been described.
As a user I want to see how many Items have been published.
As Collection Manager or Sponsor I want to describe the collection.
Violations: The [Role] is more than 1: Collection Manager, Sponsor

User Story: As a Preservation Librarian I want the relationship between masters and derivatives to be managed by the system so I don't have to.
As a Metadata Librarian I want to define the metadata schema for a collection.
As a Metadata librarian I want to define Authorities to be used for specific fields in a collection MD Schema.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) define Authorities
(2) use Authorities for specific fields in a collection MD Schema

User Story: As a Metadata Librarian I want to define validation rules for specific fields in a collection.
As a Metadata Librarian I want validation rules enforced when MD is submitted.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) validation rules enforced
(2) MD is submitted

User Story: As a user I want to be able to save a record only when the record has an identifier so that we don't end up with a bunch of empty records in the collection.
As a cataloger I want a list of all of the records I have access to so I can get to work quickly.
As a collection manager I want to search for records based on status so I can track the progress of a collection.
As a cataloger or collection manager I want to be able to search for records based on all Duke Core fields.
Violations: The [Role] is more than 1: cataloger, collection manager

User Story: As a user I want to be able to publish records only when the record has a Title Identifier Type and Source.
Violations:
The [Means] contain more than 1 tasks:
(1) publish records only when the record has a Title Identifier Type
(2) publish records only when the record has a Source
